trans-unit.source: Learn how to connect to an Azure SQL database using SSMS.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to connect to an Azure SQL database using SSMS.

trans-unit.source: Connect with SQL Server Management Studio
trans-unit.target: Connect with SQL Server Management Studio

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to install SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), connect to a database server in Azure, and then perform a simple query using Transact-SQL statements.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to install SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), connect to a database server in Azure, and then perform a simple query using Transact-SQL statements.

trans-unit.source: You'll need a SQL database in Azure first.
trans-unit.target: You'll need a SQL database in Azure first.

trans-unit.source: You can create one quickly with the instructions in [Getting Started with Microsoft Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: You can create one quickly with the instructions in [Getting Started with Microsoft Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: The examples here are based on the AdventureWorks sample database you create in that article, but the same steps, up until you perform the query, apply to any SQL database.
trans-unit.target: The examples here are based on the AdventureWorks sample database you create in that article, but the same steps, up until you perform the query, apply to any SQL database.

trans-unit.source: Install and start SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)
trans-unit.target: Install and start SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)

trans-unit.source: When working with SQL Database, you should use the most recent version of SSMS.
trans-unit.target: When working with SQL Database, you should use the most recent version of SSMS.

trans-unit.source: See [Download SQL Server Management Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt238290.aspx) to get it.
trans-unit.target: See [Download SQL Server Management Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt238290.aspx) to get it.

trans-unit.source: With the most recent version, SSMS automatically notifies you when the most recent update is available.
trans-unit.target: With the most recent version, SSMS automatically notifies you when the most recent update is available.

trans-unit.source: Start SSMS and connect to your SQL database server
trans-unit.target: Start SSMS and connect to your SQL database server

trans-unit.source: Type "Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio" in the Windows search box, and then click the desktop app to start SSMS.
trans-unit.target: Type "Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio" in the Windows search box, and then click the desktop app to start SSMS.

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect to Server** dialog box, in the **Server name** box, type the name of the server that hosts your SQL database in the format *<servername>*.**database.windows.net**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect to Server** dialog box, in the **Server name** box, type the name of the server that hosts your SQL database in the format *<servername>*.**database.windows.net**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **SQL Server Authentication** from the **Authentication** list.
trans-unit.target: Choose **SQL Server Authentication** from the **Authentication** list.

trans-unit.source: Type the **Login** and **Password** you set up when you created the server, and then click **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: Type the **Login** and **Password** you set up when you created the server, and then click **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: SSMS Connect to Azure SQL Database server
trans-unit.target: SSMS Connect to Azure SQL Database server

trans-unit.source: If the connection fails
trans-unit.target: If the connection fails

trans-unit.source: The most common reason for connection failures are mistakes in the server name, user name, or password, as well as the server not allowing connections for security reasons.
trans-unit.target: The most common reason for connection failures are mistakes in the server name, user name, or password, as well as the server not allowing connections for security reasons.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the firewall settings of the server allow connections from your local computer's IP address and the IP address that the SSMS client uses.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the firewall settings of the server allow connections from your local computer's IP address and the IP address that the SSMS client uses.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes they're different.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes they're different.

trans-unit.source: If the connection fails because of a firewall rule, the IP address is reported in the error message.
trans-unit.target: If the connection fails because of a firewall rule, the IP address is reported in the error message.

trans-unit.source: Add this IP address to the server firewall rule.
trans-unit.target: Add this IP address to the server firewall rule.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to: Configure Firewall Settings (Azure SQL Database)](sql-database-configure-firewall-settings.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to: Configure Firewall Settings (Azure SQL Database)](sql-database-configure-firewall-settings.md).
